verses.verse: {To the Director: A special Davidic psalm {56:T Heb. miktam} to the tune of {56:T Lit. David according to} "A Silent Dove Far Away,"when the Philistines seized him in Gath.} {A Prayer about Trust in God} d Have mercy on me, God, because men have harassed me. Those who oppress me have fought against me all day long.
Those who watch me all day have harassed me, for there are many who fight against me out of conceit.
On days when I am afraid, I put my trust in you.
In God, whose word I praise, in God I put my trust. I will not fear what mortal man {Lit. what flesh} can do to me.
All day long people {Lit. they} distort what I say; all their schemes against me are for evil purposes.
They gather together and hide in ambush. They watch my every step as they lie in wait for my life.
Cast them away because of their wickedness. In wrath, God, cast down these {The Heb. lacks these} people!
You have kept count of my wanderings. Put my tears in your bottle have not you recorded them in your book?
My enemies will retreat when I call on you. {The Heb. lacks on you} This has been my experience, because God is with me.
In God, whose word I praise, in the Lord , whose word I praise,
in God I will put my trust. I will not fear what mortal man can do to me.
God, I have taken vows before you; {Lit. your vows are upon me} therefore I will offer thanksgiving sacrifices to you.
For you have delivered me {Or my soul} from death and my feet from stumbling, so that I may walk before God in the light of the living!
